mapper.sql: Id, UserInfoId, Content, OperateUserId, OperateTime, AuditId,type
mapper.insert:
insert into t_userinfo_operate_log
Id,
UserInfoId,
Content,
OperateUserId,
OperateTime,
AuditId,
type,
#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR},

#{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{operateUserId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},

mapper.update:
update t_userinfo_operate_log
UserInfoId = #{userInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
Content = #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
OperateUserId = #{operateUserId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
OperateTime = #{operateTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
AuditId = #{auditId,jdbcType=BIGINT},
type= #{type,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where Id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update t_userinfo_operate_log set UserInfoId = #{userInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, Content = #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, OperateUserId = #{operateUserId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, OperateTime = #{operateTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, AuditId = #{auditId,jdbcType=BIGINT} where Id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select c.* ,concat(case when u.name is null then '' else u.name end,case when m.NICKNAME is null then '' else m.NICKNAME end ) operateUserName from t_userinfo_operate_log c left join t_userinfo u on u.id=c.OperateUserId left join manager m on m.id=c.OperateUserId
where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and c.UserInfoId like concat ('%', #{userInfoId},'%')
and c.Content like concat ('%', #{content},'%')
order by c.OperateTime desc

select
from t_userinfo_operate_log c
where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and c.UserInfoId like concat ('%', #{userInfoId},'%')
and c.Content like concat ('%', #{content},'%')
